author: brane
msg: Update Win32 build.
* libsvn_client.dsp: Add export.c. Remove apply_edits.c.
* subversion_client.dsp: Add export-cmd.c.

author: gstein
msg: Fix the dirs-changed command by using a new editor for it.
* svnlook.py:
(SVNLook.cmd_dirs_changed): pass the new DirsChangedEditor class to
the _print_tree() method. no longer worry about passing dirs_only,
as the new editor *only* does dirs.
(SVNLook.cmd_ids, SVNLook.cmd_tree): pass the Editor class and don't
worry about the do_indent flag, as the Editor class always indents
now.
(SVNLook._print_tree): take a factory object (e.g. a class) for
constructing the editor object. No longer take dirs_only or
do_indent, as we assume the factory constructs an editor with the
right options.
(Editor.__init__): don't take dirs_only or do_indent any more. These
options are now always false, true (respectively).
(Editor.open_root, Editor.add_directory, Editor.add_file): always
indent, and never worry about omitting files.
(DirsChangedEditor class): new editor class for handling the
dirs-changed command.

author: gstein
msg: Implement two more commands: ids and tree. Although this is also
"minus one" command, as I realized that dirs-changed does not print
bubble-up dirs, yet svnlook.py does right now.
* svnlook.py:
(SVNLook.cmd_dirs_changed): refactor some code out into the
_print_tree() method. add comment that we have more work to do.
(SVNLook.cmd_info): implement in terms of _print_tree
(SVNLook.cmd_tree): implement in terms of _print_tree
(SVNLook._print_tree): new method, starting with code from
cmd_dirs_changed. take a base revision, and three flag arguments
for controlling the operation of the method. the flags are passed
to the Editor class instance.
(Editor.__init__): take two flags and an optional FS root for
looking up IDs.
(Editor.open_root): fetch and print the id (if the option is
enabled). adjust the indent, if the flag states we should.
(Editor.add_directory): fetch and print the id. if indenting, then
manage the indent and only print the basename. change the
parameters so we can use this function for open_directory(), too.
(Editor.open_directory): body removed, this method is now set to be
equivalent to the add_directory method.
(Editor.close_directory): new. manage the indent.
(Editor.add_file): new. print files and ids, as controlled by flags.
(Editor.open_file): new. same as add_file.
(_basename): new function to compute the basename of a '/' seperated
path.

author: gstein
msg: * main.c (print_tree): minor nit -- remove an extraneous trailing
space when printing out node names.

author: gstein
msg: Fix minor typo in the Editor.open_file method's parameters.
